 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לִילִית‎</span> **noun feminine** ==Lilith== (Milton [[BDB#Che|Che]] ***night-hag***), name of a female night-demon haunting desolate Edom; probably borrowed from Babylonian, [[Isa.34.14|Isa 34:14]] (Late Hebrew ***id.***; Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***lilîtu***</u></abbr>, [[BDB#Dl|Dl]]<sup>HWB 377</sup>; Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> [[BDB#PS|PS]]<sup>1951</sup>; on the development of legends of Lilith in later Judaism, see [[BDB#Bux|Bux]]<sup>Lex. Talmud., under the word</sup> [[BDB#Che|Che]]<sup>on the passage</sup> Grünbaum<sup>ZMG xxxi.1877, 250 f.</sup> — Connexion with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לילה‎</span> perhaps only apparent, a popular etymology). <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לִין‎</span> see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לון‎</span>.
